pt.aodispor.aodispor_android

Class CardFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • pt.aodispor.aodispor_android.CardFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, HttpRequest
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CardFragmentTestClass

    public class CardFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements HttpRequest
    Class representing a card stack fragment.

    This class controls all the behaviours of the card stack such as the discarding of a card. This class initializes the stack of cards in an array of RelativeLayout and iterates them.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  CardFragment.QueryResult
      used to know if the query was successful or not.
      protected static class  CardFragment.RequestType
      used by preparePage and onHttpRequestCompleted to know if the request is to get the previous or next page or an enterily new query

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater i,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup c,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This method creates the View of this card stack fragment.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        i - the LayoutInflater object to inflate card_zone.xml and card.xml.
        c - the root ViewGroup.
        savedInstanceState - object with saved states of previously created fragment.
        Returns:
        returns the root view of the fragment. Not to be confused with the root ViewGroup of this fragment.

      • setCardMargin

        public void setCardMargin(int position)
        This method sets a card's margin from the stack so that it gives the illusion of seeing the stack in perspective with the cards on top of each other.
        Parameters:
        position - the position in the stack of a card.

      • setupNewStack

        public void setupNewStack()
        to be called when doing a new search

      • discardTopCard

        public void discardTopCard()
        This method discards the top card of the card stack, destroys it and brings the other cards one position further in the stack. After that creates a new card to be on the bottom of the stack.
        Also responsible for requesting the loading of the next page and updating the currentSet and nextSet.

      • restorePreviousCard

        public void restorePreviousCard()
        Recovers the previous discarded card reponsable for requesting the loading of the previous page and updating the currentSet and nextSet

      • putCardOnStack

        public void putCardOnStack(int stackIndex,
                           Professional professional)
        Because a professional details are separated from the card display use this auxiliary method to insert new professionals into the card stack
        Parameters:
        stackIndex - 0,1 or 2 (the higher the index the lower it is on the stack)
        professional -
